meta.@content: This scene provides tool developers with X3D Amendment 1 CAD Component node prototypes, providing backwards compatibility with VRML97 and X3D v3.0.
Travis Rauch, Alan Shaffer, Mounir Sidhom, Patrick Sullivan and Don Brutzman
Do not use these prototypes in an up-to-date X3D browser that already provides CAD support.
Recommended practice: avoid using these prototypes, instead use native definitions for CAD nodes using an up-to-date X3D browser.

These scenes are not intended for regular authoring - use X3D v3.2 CAD component instead. Example scenes using these prototypes do not get support for making embdedded metadata values visible at run time, though metadata can certainly be saved in the scene file OK.
CADAssembly CADFace CADLayer CADPart IndexedQuadSet QuadSet

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo: The IndexedQuadSet node represents a 3D shape composed of a collection of individual quadrilaterals (quads). IndexedQuadSet uses the indices in its index field to specify the vertices of each quad from the coord field. Each quad is formed from a set of four vertices of the Coordinate node identified by four consecutive indices from the index field If the index field does not contain a multiple of four coordinate values the remaining vertices shall be ignored.

field.@appinfo: colorPerVertex ignored in IndexedQuadSet, and always treated as true

-children.#comment: Initial node in the PROTO body is actual node type, and the only node rendered. Remaining ProtoBody nodes not rendered

#sourceText: //colorPerVertex ignored in IndexedQuadSet, and always treated as "true"
// index is an array of quad indices. The ordering of
alwaysPrint ('error, index[' + ii + ']=' + index[ii] + ' is illegal value');
alwaysPrint ('warning, index.length=' + index.length + ' insufficient to construct a quad, IQS ignored');
// goal is to initialize coordIndexNew list to match quads
alwaysPrint ('error, pair of equal indices in quad');
// add another quad from latest 4 points of fan set to IQS
// order is ccw, i.e. in correct halfplane direction
// note: there is an implicit "malloc" here for the'length' element of the array
alwaysPrint ('error, index field does not contain a multiple of four coordinate values.');
alwaysPrint ('The remaining vertices shall be ignored');
// incremental trace of array being built
// match colorIndex if any Color node exists
//  Could implement color count check here
// no need to set colorIndex since indexedFaceSet semantics handles this

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo: The QuadSet node represents a 3D shape that represents a collection of individual planar quadrilaterals. The coord field contains a Coordinate node that defines the 3D vertices that define the quad. Each quad is formed from a consecutive set of four vertices of the coordinate node. If the coordinate node does not contain a multiple of four coordinate values the remaining vertices shall be ignored.

field.@appinfo: colorPerVertex ignored in QuadSet, and always treated as true

-children.#comment: Initial node in the PROTO body is actual node type, and the only node rendered. Remaining ProtoBody nodes not rendered

#sourceText: //colorPerVertex ignored in QuadSet, and always treated as "true"
// calculate index value from QuadSet coord values
alwaysPrint ('warning, numberOfCoordinatePoints=' + numberOfCoordinatePoints + ' insufficient to construct a quad, QuadSet ignored');
// goal is to initialize coordIndexNew list to match quads
// check if at least 4 vertices remaining to build a quad
alwaysPrint ('error, index field does not contain a multiple' +
alwaysPrint ('The remaining vertices shall be ignored');
alwaysPrint ('error, pair of equal indices in quad');
// add another quad from latest 4 points of fan set to QS
// order is ccw, i.e. in correct halfplane direction
// note: there is an implicit "malloc" here for the'length' element of the array
// incremental trace of array being built
// match colorIndex if any Color node exists
//  Could implement color count check here
// no need to set colorIndex since indexedFaceSet semantics handles this

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo: The CADAssembly node holds a set of assemblies or parts grouped together.

field.@appinfo: The children field can contain X3DProductStructureChildNode types. Each child will be either a sub-assembly or a part.
The name field documents the name of this CADAssembly.
Bounding box center: position offset from origin of local coordinate system.
Bounding box size: automatically calculated can be specified as an optimization or constraint.

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo: local dummy node to hold value for CADFace

#sourceText: // no script code, this node is simply a container
// silence warning: no function provided that includes shape = something;

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo: The CADFace node holds the geometry representing a face of a part.

field.@appinfo: The name field documents the name of this CADFace.
Bounding box center: position offset from origin of local coordinate system.
Bounding box size: automatically calculated can be specified as an optimization or constraint.

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo: The CADLayer node defines a hierarchy of nodes used for showing layer structure.

field.@appinfo: The children field can contain X3DChildNode types.
The name field documents the name of this CADLayer.
specifies whether a particular child and its subchildren are visible. If the number of values is less than the number of children the remaining children shall be visible.
Bounding box center: position offset from origin of local coordinate system.
Bounding box size: automatically calculated can be specified as an optimization or constraint.

#sourceText: // no script code, this node is simply a container

-children.#comment: No support for MFBool in VRML97, so no functionality provided for visible

ProtoDeclare.@appinfo: CADPart represents the location and faces that constitute apart

field.@appinfo: The children field can only contain CADFace nodes.

-children.#comment: Silence scene warnings by providing ordered ProtoInstance examples. Note warning above that this scene is for developmental use. The ProtoInstance form of the CAD nodes should not be used, native X3D encoding should be used instead.
